sentences.text: NOTICE OF ANNUAL MEETING OF STOCKHOLDERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To Be Held April 20, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Meeting of Stockholders of J.B. Hunt Transport Services, Inc. (the Company) will be held April 20, 2017, at 10 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CDT) at the Companys headquarters, located at 615 J.B. Hunt Corporate Drive in Lowell, Arkansas, for the following purposes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) To elect Directors for a term of one (1) year
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) To approve the Companys Third Amended and Restated Management Incentive Plan, including the material terms of the performance goals under such plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) To consider and approve an advisory resolution regarding the Companys compensation of its named executive of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (4) To consider and act upon an advisory vote to determine the frequency with which stockholders will consider and approve an advisory vote on the Companys compensation of its named executive officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (5) To ratify the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for the 2017 calendar year
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (6) To consider a stockholder proposal regarding reporting political contributions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (7) To transact such other business as may properly come before the Annual Meeting or any adjournments thereof
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only stockholders of record on February 14, 2017, will be entitled to vote at the meeting or any adjournments thereof.

sentences.text: The stock transfer books will not be closed.

sentences.text: PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proxy Statement is furnished in connection with the solicitation of proxies by J.B. Hunt Transport Services, Inc. (the Company), on behalf of its Board of Directors (the Board), for the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders (the Annual Meeting).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Proxy Statement and the related proxy card are being distributed on or about March 9, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IMPORTANT NOTICE REGARDING THE AVAILABILITY OF PROXY MATERIALS FOR THE STOCKHOLDERS MEETING TO BE HELD APRIL 20, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proxy Statement and our 2016 Annual Report to Stockholders, which includes our Annual Report on Form 10-K, are available at www.jbhunt.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS ABOUT THE PROXY MATERIALS AND THE ANNUAL MEETING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When And Where Is The Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Date: Thursday, April 20, 2017 Time: 10 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Central Daylight Time Location: J.B. Hunt Transport Services, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Offices   First-Floor Auditorium   615 J.B. Hunt Corporate Drive   Lowell, Arkansas 72745
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What Matters Will Be Voted Upon At The Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Annual Meeting, you will be asked to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consider and vote upon a proposal to elect nominees Douglas G. Duncan, Francesca M. Edwardson, Wayne Garrison, Sharilyn S. Gasaway, Gary C. George, Bryan Hunt, Coleman H. Peterson, John N. Roberts, III, James L. Robo, and Kirk Thompson as directors to hold office for a term of one year, expiring at the close of the Annual Meeting of Stockholders in 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consider and vote upon a proposal to approve the Companys Third Amended and Restated Management Incentive Plan, including the material terms of the performance goals under such plan pursuant to Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code, as amended (the Code).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consider and approve an advisory resolution regarding the Companys compensation of its named executive officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consider and vote on an advisory basis, the frequency of a stockholder advisory vote on the Companys compensation of its named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consider and vote upon a proposal to ratify the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP (E&Y) as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for the 2017 calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consider and vote upon a stockholder proposal requesting the Company to prepare and disclose a report of the Companys political contributions policy and political contributions made by the Company that could not be deducted under section 162(e) of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transact such other business as may properly come before the Annual Meeting or any adjournments thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What Constitutes A Quorum?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The presence, either in person or by proxy, of the holders of at least a majority of our issued and outstanding shares of common stock ntitled to vote is required to constitute a quorum for the transaction of business at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker non-votes, which are described in more detail below, are counted as shares present at the Annual Meeting for purposes of determining whether a uorum exists.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who Is Entitled To Vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only stockholders of record of the Companys common stock at the close of business on Tuesday, February 14, 2017, which is the record date, are entitled to notice of, and to vote at, the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares that may be voted include shares that are held:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) directly by the stockholder of record, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) beneficially through a broker, bank or other nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each share of our common stock will be entitled to one vote on all matters submitted for a vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the record date, there were 111,310,853 shares of our common stock issued and outstanding and entitled to be voted at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What Is The Difference Between Holding Shares As A Registered Owner And A Beneficial Owner?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Registered Owners  If your shares are registered directly in your name with our transfer agent, Computershare Trust Company N.A., you are, with respect to those shares, the stockholder of record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the stockholder of record, you have the right to grant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: your voting proxy directly to the Company or to vote in person at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial Owners  If your shares are held in a brokerage account, bank or by another nominee, you are, with respect to those shares, the beneficial owner of shares held in street name.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the beneficial owner, you have the right to direct your broker, bank or other nominee on how to vote or to vote in person at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, since you are not a stockholder of record, you may not vote these shares in person at the Annual Meeting unless you obtain a legal proxy from your broker, bank or other nominee (who is the stockholder of record) giving you the right to vote the shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What Stockholder Approval Is Necessary For Approval Of The Proposals?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director shall be elected by a vote of the majority of votes cast with respect to that director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This means that a director must receive for votes from more than 50% of the number of shares voted with respect to that director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if the number of nominees is greater than the number of directors to be elected, the directors will be elected by the vote of a plurality of the shares represented in person or by proxy at any stockholder meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approval of the Companys Third Amended and Restated Management Incentive Plan, including the material terms of the performance goals under such plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The approval of the Companys Third Amended and Restated Management Incentive Plan, including the material terms of the performance goals under such plan pursuant to Section 162(m) of the Code, requires the affirmative vote of the majority of the votes cast at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of this vote, a failure to vote, a vote to abstain or withholding your vote (or direction to your broker to do so) are not counted as votes cast and, therefore, will have no effect on the outcome of this vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder approval is required for the Companys Third Amended and Restated Management Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advisory vote on the resolution to approve the Companys compensation of its named executive officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approval of this resolution requires the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While this vote is required by law, it will neither be binding on the Company or the Board, nor will it create or imply any change in the fiduciary duties of, or impose any additional fiduciary duty on, the Company or the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Compensation Committee will take into account the outcome of the vote when considering future executive compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advisory vote on the frequency of stockholder advisory votes on the Companys compensation of its named executive officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, approval of any matter presented to stockholders requires a majority of votes cast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, because this vote is advisory and nonbinding, if none of the frequency options (1 year, 2 years or 3 years) receives a majority of the votes cast, the option receiving the greatest number of votes will be considered the frequency recommended by the Companys stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even though this vote will neither be binding on the Company or the Board, nor will it create or imply any change in the fiduciary duties of, or impose any additional fiduciary duty on, the Company or the Board, the Board of Directors will take into account the outcome of this vote in making a determination on the frequency with which advisory votes on executive compensation will be included in the Companys Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ratification of the appointment of E&Y as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ratification of the Audit Committees appointment of E&Y as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm requires the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of this vote, a failure to vote, a vote to abstain or withholding your vote (or direction to your broker to do so) is not counted as a vote cast and, therefore, will have no effect on the outcome of this vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder ratification is not required for the appointment of the Companys independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, we are submitting the proposal to solicit the opinion of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote on a stockholder proposal requesting the Company to prepare and disclose a report of the Companys political contributions policy and political contributions made by the Company that could not be deducted under section 162(e) of the Internal Revenue Code
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approval of this resolution requires the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of this vote, a failure to vote, a vote to abstain or withholding your vote (or direction to your broker to do so) is not counted as a vote cast and, therefore, will have no effect on the outcome of this vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the record date, directors and executive officers of the Company beneficially owned an aggregate 4,736,668 shares of common stock representing 4.3% of our common stock issued and outstanding and, therefore, 4.3% of the voting power entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that its directors and executive officers currently intend to vote their shares as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the election of directors for one (1) year   FOR the resolution approving the Companys Third Amended and Restated Management Incentive Plan, including the material terms of the performance goals under such plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the resolution approving the Companys compensation of its named executive officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR a stockholder advisory vote on the Companys executive compensation every year
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AGAINST the stockholder proposal requesting the Company to prepare and disclose a report of the Companys political
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: contributions policy and political contributions made by the Company that could not be deducted under section 162(e) of the Internal Revenue Code
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are the registered owner of shares of the Companys common stock on the record date, you have the right to vote your shares in person at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are the beneficial owner of shares of the Companys common stock on the record date, you may vote these shares in person at the Annual Meeting if you request and obtain a legal proxy from your broker, bank or other nominee (the stockholder of record) giving you the right to vote the shares at the Annual Meeting, complete such legal proxy and present it to the Company at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if you plan to attend the Annual Meeting, we recommend that you submit your proxy card or voting instructions so that your vote will be counted if you later decide not to attend the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How Can I Vote My Shares Without Attending The Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a registered owner, you may instruct the named proxy holders on how to vote your shares by completing, signing, dating and returning the enclosed proxy card in the postage-paid envelope provided with this Proxy Statement, or by using the Internet voting site or the toll-free telephone number listed on the proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specific instructions for using the Internet and telephone voting systems are provided on the proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Internet and telephone voting systems will be available until 11:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Central Daylight Time on Wednesday, April 19, 2017 (the day before the Annual Meeting).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are the beneficial owner of shares held in street name, you should instruct your broker, bank or other nominee on how to vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your broker, bank or other nominee has enclosed with this Proxy Statement a voting instruction card for you to use in directing your nominee on how to vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The instructions from your nominee will indicate whether Internet or telephone voting is available and, if so, will provide details regarding how to use those systems.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If My Shares Are Held In Street Name, Will My Broker, Bank Or Other Nominee Vote My Shares For Me?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold shares in street name through a broker, bank or other nominee, your broker, bank or nominee may not be permitted to exercise voting discretion with respect to some of the matters to be acted upon at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under current stock exchange rules, brokers who do not have instructions from their customers may not use their discretion in voting their customers shares on certain specific matters that are not considered to be routine matters, including the election of directors, executive compensation and other significant matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proposals in this Proxy Statement regarding the election of directors, the approval of the Companys Third Amended and Restated Management Incentive Plan, the advisory votes concerning executive compensation, and the frequency of future stockholder advisory votes on executive compensation, and the Companys political contributions policy are not considered to be routine matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, without your specific instructions, your shares will not be voted on these matters and will not be counted in determining the number of shares necessary for approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares represented by such broker non-votes, however, will be counted in determining whether there is a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You should follow the directions provided by your nominee regarding instructions on how to vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ratification of the appointment of E&Y as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm is considered a routine matter and, therefore, if beneficial owners fail to give voting instructions, brokers, banks and other nominees will have the discretionary authority to vote shares of our common stock with respect to this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What Is A Broker Non-Vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, a broker non-vote occurs when a broker, bank or other nominee that holds shares in street name for a customer is precluded from exercising voting discretion on a particular proposal because:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) the beneficial owner has not instructed the nominee on how to vote, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) the nominee lacks discretionary voting power to vote such issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under NASDAQ rules, a nominee does not have discretionary voting power with respect to the approval of nonroutine matters absent specific voting instructions from the beneficial owners of such shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How Will My Proxy Be Voted?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares represented by a properly executed proxy (in paper form, by Internet or by telephone) that is received in a timely manner, and not subsequently revoked, will be voted at the Annual Meeting or any adjournment or postponement thereof in the manner directed on the proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Kirk Thompson and John N. Roberts, III are named as proxies in the proxy form and have been designated by the Board as the directors proxies to represent you and vote your shares at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shares represented by a properly executed proxy on which no choice is specified will be voted:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) FOR the election of the nominees for director named in this Proxy Statement,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) FOR the resolution approving the Companys Third Amended and Restated Management Incentive Plan, including the material terms of the performance goals under such plan,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) FOR the resolution approving the Companys compensation of its named executive officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (4) FOR a stockholder advisory vote on the Companys executive compensation every year,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (5) FOR ratification of the appointment of E&Y as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for the 2017 calendar year,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (6) AGAINST the stockholder proposal requesting the Company to prepare and disclose a report of the Companys political contributions policy and political contributions made by the Company that could not be deducted under section 162(e) of the Internal Revenue Code, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (7) in accordance with the proxy holders best judgment as to any other business that properly comes before the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proxy Statement is considered to be voting instructions for the trustees of the J.B. Hunt Transport Services, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employee Retirement Plan for our common stock allocated to individual accounts under this plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If account information is the same, participants in the plan (who are stockholders of record) will receive a single proxy representing all of their shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a plan participant does not submit a proxy to us, the trustees of the plan in which shares are allocated to his or her individual account will vote such shares in the same proportion as the total shares in such plan for which directions have been received.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: May I Revoke My Proxy And Change My Vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Yes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may revoke your proxy and change your vote at any time prior to the vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are the registered owner, you may revoke your proxy and change your vote by:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) submitting a new proxy bearing a later date (which automatically revokes the earlier proxy),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) giving notice of your changed vote to us in writing mailed to the attention of David G. Mee, Corporate Secretary, at our executive offices, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) attending the Annual Meeting and giving oral notice of your intention to vote in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You should be aware that simply attending the Annual Meeting will not in and of itself constitute a revocation of your proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who Will Pay The Costs Of Soliciting Proxies?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies will be solicited initially by mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further solicitation may be made in person or by telephone, electronic mail or facsimile.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company will bear the expense of preparing, printing and mailing this Proxy Statement and accompanying materials to our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon request, the Company will reimburse brokers, banks and other nominees for reasonable expenses incurred in forwarding copies of the proxy materials relating to the Annual Meeting to the beneficial owners of our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Company retained Broadridge, an independent proxy solicitation firm, to assist in soliciting proxies from stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broadridge received a fee of approximately $79,000 as compensation for its services and was reimbursed for its out-of-pocket expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fee amount was not contingent on the number of stockholder votes cast in favor of any proposal, and Broadridge is prohibited from making any recommendation to our stockholders to either accept or reject any proposal or otherwise express an opinion concerning a proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy solicitation fees in 2017 are expected to be comparable to those paid in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What Other Business Will Be Presented At The Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the date of this Proxy Statement, the Board knows of no other business that may properly be, or is likely to be, brought before the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any other matters should arise at the Annual Meeting, the persons named as proxy holders, Kirk Thompson and John N. Roberts, III, will have the discretion to vote your shares on any additional matters properly presented for a vote at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If, for any unforeseen reason, any of the director nominees are not available to serve as a director, the named proxy holders will vote your proxy for such other director candidate or candidates as may be nominated by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What Is The Deadline For Stockholder Proposals For The 2018 Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order for a stockholder proposal to be eligible to be included in the Companys Proxy Statement and proxy card for the 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, the proposal:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) must be received by the Company at its executive offices, 615 J.B. Hunt Corporate Drive, Lowell, Arkansas 72745, Attention: Corporate Secretary, on or before November 9, 2017, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) must concern a matter that may be properly considered and acted upon at the Annual Meeting in accordance with applicable laws, regulations and the Companys Bylaws and policies, and must otherwise comply with Rule 14a-8 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the Exchange Act).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Where Can I Find The Voting Results Of The Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company will publish final voting results of the Annual Meeting on a Form 8-K within four days after the annual stockholders meeting on April 20, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What Should I Do If I Receive More Than One Set Of Voting Materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may receive more than one set of voting materials, including multiple copies of this Proxy Statement and multiple proxies or voting instruction cards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, if you hold your shares in more than one brokerage account, you may receive a separate voting instruction card for each brokerage account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a registered owner and your shares are registered in more than one name, you will receive more than one proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please vote each proxy and instruction card that you receive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In an effort to reduce printing costs and postage fees, the Company has adopted a practice approved by the Securities and Exchange Commission (the SEC) called householding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this practice, certain stockholders who have the same address and last name will receive only one copy of this Proxy Statement and the Companys Annual Report, unless one or more of these stockholders notifies the Company that he or she wishes to continue receiving individual copies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who participate in householding will continue to receive separate proxy cards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you share an address with another stockholder and received only one copy of this Proxy Statement and the Companys Annual Report and would like to request a separate copy of these materials, or if you do not wish to participate in householding in the future, please:

sentences.text: What Do I Need To Do Now?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: First, read this Proxy Statement carefully.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Then, if you are a registered owner, you should, as soon as possible, submit your proxy by xecuting and returning the proxy card or by voting electronically via the Internet or by telephone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are the beneficial owner of shares held in street name, then you should follow the voting instructions of your broker, bank or other nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your shares will be voted in ccordance with the directions you specify.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you submit an executed proxy card to the Company, but fail to specify voting directions, your hares will be voted:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) FOR the resolution approving the Companys Third Amended and Restated Management Incentive Plan, including the material terms of the performance goals under such plan,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (4) FOR a stockholder advisory vote on the Companys executive compensation every year,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (5) FOR ratification of the appointment of E&Y as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for the 2017 calendar year, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (6) AGAINST the stockholder proposal requesting the Company to prepare and disclose a report of the Companys political contributions policy and political contributions made by the Company that could not be deducted under section 162(e) of the Internal Revenue Code.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board nominates Douglas G. Duncan, Francesca M. Edwardson, Wayne Garrison, Sharilyn S. Gasaway, Gary C. George, Bryan Hunt, Coleman H. Peterson, John N. Roberts, III, James L. Robo, and Kirk Thompson as directors to hold office for a term of one year, expiring at the close of the 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders or until their successors are elected and qualified or until their earlier resignation or removal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that these incumbent directors standing for re-election are well-qualified and experienced to direct and manage the Companys operations and business affairs and will represent the interests of the stockholders as a whole.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Biographical information on each of these nominees is set forth below in Nominees for Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any director nominee becomes unavailable for election, which is not anticipated, the named proxies will vote for the election of such other person as the Board may nominate, unless the Board resolves to reduce the number of directors to serve on the Board and thereby reduce the number of directors to be elected at the Annual Meeting.

sentences.text: DIRECTORS AND EXECUTIVE OFFICERS OF THE COMPANY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Number of Directors and Term of Directors and Executive Officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Bylaws provide that the number of directors shall not be less than three or more than 12, with the exact number to be fixed by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors serve a term of one year from their election date to the Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are elected by a majority of votes cast with respect to each director, provided that the number of nominees does not exceed the number of directors to be elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stockholders of the Company elect at the Companys Annual Meeting successors for directors whose terms have expired.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board elects members to fill new membership positions and vacancies in unexpired terms on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No director will be eligible to stand for re-election or be elected to a vacancy once he or she has reached 72 years of age.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officers are elected by the Board and hold office until their successors are elected and qualified or until their earlier death, retirement, resignation or removal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOMINEES FOR DIRECTOR
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TERMS EXPIRE 2018
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Douglas G. Duncan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Duncan, 66, was elected to the Board in 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is a member of the Audit Committee and the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2010, he retired as President and Chief Executive Officer of FedEx Freight Corporation, a wholly owned subsidiary of FedEx Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FedEx Freight Corporation is a leading provider of regional and national less-than- truckload (LTL) freight services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Duncan was the founding chief executive officer of FedEx Freight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also served on the Strategic Management Committee of FedEx Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Before the formation of FedEx Freight, he served for two years as President and Chief Executive Officer of Viking Freight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With 30 years of transportation experience, Mr. Duncan has held management positions in operations, sales and marketing with Caliber System and Roadway Express.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He served on the Executive Committee of the American Trucking Associations and as Chairman of the American Transportation Research Institute.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A graduate of Christopher Newport University, Mr. Duncan served on the universitys Board of Visitors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He currently serves on the Board of Directors of Benchmark Electronics, Inc. and served on the Board of Directors of Brambles LTD.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Edwardson, 59, was elected to the Board in 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She serves on the Companys Executive Compensation Committee and the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She retired as the Chief Executive Officer of the American Red Cross of Chicago and Northern Illinois, a business unit of the American Red Cross, in 2016, a position she held since 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She previously served as Senior Vice President and General Counsel for UAL Corporation, a predecessor company to United Continental Holdings, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She has also been a partner in the law firm of Mayer Brown and the Executive Director of the Illinois Securities Department.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Edwardson is a graduate of Loyola University in Chicago, Illinois, holding degrees in economics and law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She serves on the Board of Directors of Duluth Holdings, Inc., where she chairs the Compensation Committee, and also serves on the Boards of Trustees for Rush University Medical Center and the Lincoln Park Zoo.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Garrison, 64, was elected to the Board in 1981.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He served as Chairman of the Board of the Company from 1995 to December 31, 2010, and continues to serve as a member of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Joining the Company in 1976 as Plant Manager, Mr. Garrison has also served as Vice President of Finance in 1978, Executive Vice President of Finance in 1979, President in 1982, Chief Executive Officer in 1987 and Vice Chairman of the Board from January 1986 until May 1991.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sharilyn S. Gasaway
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mrs. Gasaway, 48, was elected to the Board in 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She is a member of the Audit Committee, Compensation Committee, and the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She served as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of Alltel Corp., the Little Rock, Arkansas-based Fortune 500 wireless carrier, from 2006 to 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She was part of the executive team that spearheaded publicly traded Alltels transition through the largest private equity buyout in the telecom sector and was an integral part of the successful combination of Alltel and Verizon.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She also served as Alltels Corporate Controller and Principal Accounting Officer from 2002 to 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Joining Alltel in 1999, she served as Director of General Accounting, Controller, and Vice President of Accounting and Finance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining Alltel, she worked for eight years at Arthur Andersen LLC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mrs. Gasaway has a degree in accounting from Louisiana Tech University and is a Certified Public Accountant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She currently serves on the Board of Directors, chairs the Audit Committee and serves on the Governance, Compensation and Business Development Committee of Genesis Energy, LP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She also serves on the Board of Directors and the Audit, Investment, and Nominating and Corporate Governance Committees of Waddell & Reed Financial, Inc., as well as on the Louisiana Tech University Foundation and College of Business Advisory Board and the Board of Directors of Arkansas Childrens, Inc., and Arkansas Childrens Foundation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. George, 66, was elected to the Board in 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is Chairman of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee and a member of the Executive Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is Chairman of Georges, Inc., a private, fully integrated poultry company in northwest Arkansas, Missouri, and Virginia.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is a graduate of the University of Arkansas with a degree in business administration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He served on the Board of Trustees for the University of Arkansas from 1995 through 2005 and was Chairman of the Board of Trustees in 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also serves as Chairman of the Board of Legacy National Bank in Springdale, Arkansas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, he serves on the Board of Directors of Arkansas Childrens, Inc., Arkansas Childrens Northwest, and the National Chicken Council.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Hunt, 58, was elected to the Board in 1991.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Hunt served as an employee of the Company from 1983 through 1997.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is the Managing Member of Best Buy Here Pay Here of Arkansas, a private company with used-car operations in Arkansas, Missouri and Oklahoma; Progressive Car Finance, a private company that provides subprime financing for automobile dealers; and 71B Auto Auction and I-135 Auto Auction, both private companies engaged in the auction of automobiles, trucks, boats and other motor vehicles to dealers and the general public in Arkansas and Kansas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A graduate of the University of Arkansas, he has a degree in marketing and transportation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is the son of co-founders J.B. and Johnelle Hunt.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Peterson, 68, was elected to the Board in 2004.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is Chairman of the Executive Compensation Committee and a member of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Peterson is the President and CEO of Hollis Enterprises LLC, a human resources consulting firm founded in 2004.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is retired from Wal-Mart Stores, Inc. as Executive Vice President of its People Division.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During his tenure, Mr. Peterson was responsible for recruitment, retention and development of the worlds largest corporate work force.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to his experience with Wal-Mart, Mr. Peterson spent 16 years with Venture Stores, with his last position being Senior Vice President of Human Resources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He holds bachelors and masters degrees from Loyola University of Chicago.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Peterson serves on the Board of Directors, chairs the Compensation Committee, and serves on the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee of Build-A-Bear Workshop.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also serves on the Board of Directors, chairs the Compensation Committee, and serves on the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Roberts, 52, was elected to the Board in 2010, and was elected to serve as the Companys President and Chief Executive Officer effective January 1, 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A graduate of the University of Arkansas, he served as Executive Vice President and President of Dedicated Contract Services from 1997 to December 31, 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Joining the Company in 1989, he began his career as a Management Trainee and subsequently served as an EDI Services Coordinator, Regional Marketing Manager for the Intermodal and Truckload business units, Business Development Executive for DCS and Vice President of Marketing Strategy for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Roberts also serves on the Board of Directors and the Audit Committee of the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: James L. Robo
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Robo, 54, was elected to the Board in 2002.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is the Independent Lead Director, Chairman of the Audit Committee, and a member of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Robo is Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of NextEra Energy, Inc., a leading clean energy company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is Chairman of the companys rate-regulated electric utility subsidiary, Florida Power & Light Company, as well as Chairman and CEO of NextEra Energy Partners, LP, a growth-oriented limited partnership formed by NextEra Energy to acquire, manage and own contracted clean energy projects.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining NextEra Energy in 2002, Mr. Robo spent 10 years at General Electric Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He served as President and Chief Executive Officer of GE Mexico from 1997 until 1999 and as President and Chief Executive Officer of the GE Capital TIP/Modular Space division from 1999 until February 2002.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1984 through 1992, Mr. Robo worked for Mercer Management Consulting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He received a BA summa cum laude from Harvard College and an MBA from Harvard Business School, where he was a Baker Scholar.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Kirk Thompson
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Thompson, 63, was elected to the Board in 1985.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was elected Chairman of the Board in 2010, assuming that office on January 1, 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He served as President and Chief Executive Officer from 1987 to December 31, 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A graduate of the University of Arkansas and a Certified Public Accountant, Mr. Thompson joined the Company in 1973.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He served as Vice President of Finance from 1979 until 1984, Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer until 1985, and President and Chief Operating Officer from 1986 until 1987, when he was elected President and Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2014, Mr. Thompson joined the Board of Directors of Rand Logistics, Inc., a leading provider of bulk freight shipping services in marine vessels throughout the Great Lakes region.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that good corporate governance helps to ensure that the Company is managed for the long-term benefit of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continually review and consider our corporate governance policies and practices, the SECs corporate governance rules and regulations, and the corporate governance listing standards of NASDAQ, the stock exchange on which our common stock is traded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key corporate governance principles observed by the Board and Company include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: maintaining a Board composed of a majority of directors who satisfy the criteria for independence under the NASDAQ listing standards,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: requiring that all committees of the Board be comprised solely of independent directors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: establishment of formal charters outlining the purpose, composition, and responsibility of each committee of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: establishment of qualification guidelines for director nominees,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: adoption of a formal Code of Ethical and Professional Standards applicable to all directors, officers and employees of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can access and print the Charters of our Audit Committee, Executive Compensation Committee (Compensation Committee), and Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee (Corporate Governance Committee), as well as our Corporate Code of Ethical and Professional Standards for Directors, Officers and Employees, Whistleblower Policy, and other Company policies and procedures required by applicable law, regulation or NASDAQ corporate governance listing standards on the Corporate Governance page of the Investors section of our website at www.jbhunt.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, you can request copies of any of these documents by writing to our Corporate Secretary at the following address:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attention: Corporate Secretary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is composed of a majority of directors who satisfy the criteria for independence under the NASDAQ corporate governance listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining independence, each year the Board affirmatively determines, among other items, whether the directors have no material relationship with the Company or any of its subsidiaries pursuant to the NASDAQ corporate governance listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When assessing the materiality of a directors relationship with the Company, if any, the Board considers all relevant facts and circumstances, not merely from the directors standpoint, but from that of the persons or organizations with which the director has an affiliation and the frequency or regularity of the services, whether the services are being carried out at arms length in the ordinary course of business, and whether the services are being provided substantially on the same terms to the Company as those prevailing at the time from unrelated parties for comparable transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Material relationships can include commercial, banking, industrial, consulting, legal, accounting, charitable and familial relationships.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also considers any other relationship that could interfere with the exercise of independence or judgment in carrying out the duties of a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Applying these independence standards, the Board has determined that Douglas G. Duncan, Francesca M. Edwardson, Sharilyn S. Gasaway, Gary C. George, Coleman H. Peterson, and James L. Robo are all independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After due consideration, the Board has determined that none of these nonemployee directors has a material relationship with the Company or any of its subsidiaries (either directly or indirectly as a partner, stockholder or officer of any organization that has a relationship with the Company or any of its subsidiaries) and that they all meet the criteria for independence under the NASDAQ corporate governance listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Management and Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As previously described in their biographies, current members of our Board represent diverse backgrounds of business and academic experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board, as a whole, performs the risk oversight of the Company and does not assign the task or responsibility to any one member or a committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the Board believes that the members each possess unique yet complementary experiences and backgrounds that create diverse points of view, opinions, personalities and management styles that allow for the proper risk management and oversight of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Lead Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has established the position of Independent Lead Director, to which James L. Robo was appointed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Independent Lead Director directs the executive sessions of independent directors at the Board meetings at which the Chairman is not present and has authority to call meetings of independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Independent Lead Director facilitates communication between the Chairman, the CEO and the independent directors, as appropriate, and performs such other functions as the Board directs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Director Meetings
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent directors generally meet in executive session as part of each regularly scheduled Board meeting, with discussion led by the Independent Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Recommendations by Stockholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to recommendations from Board members, management or professional search firms, the Corporate Governance Committee will consider director candidates properly submitted by stockholders who individually or as a group have beneficially owned at least 2% of the outstanding shares of the Companys common stock for at least one year from the date the recommendation is submitted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders must submit director candidate recommendations in writing by Certified Mail to the Companys Corporate Secretary not less than 120 days prior to the first anniversary of the date of the Proxy Statement relating to the Companys previous Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, for the 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, director candidates must be submitted to the Companys Corporate Secretary by November 9, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director candidates submitted by stockholders must contain at least the following information:     the name and address of the recommending stockholder,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the number of shares of the Companys common stock beneficially owned by the recommending stockholder and the dates such shares were purchased,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a description of the candidates qualifications to serve as a director, including financial expertise and why the candidate does or does not qualify as independent under the NASDAQ corporate governance listing standards,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the number of shares of the Companys common stock beneficially owned by the candidate, if any, and   a description of the arrangements or understandings between the recommending stockholder and the candidate, if any, or any other person pursuant to which the recommending stockholder is making the recommendation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the recommending stockholder and the candidate must submit, with the recommendation, a signed statement agreeing and cknowledging that:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the candidate consents to being a director candidate and, if nominated and elected, he or she will serve as a director representing all of the Companys stockholders in accordance with applicable laws and the Companys Articles of Incorporation and Bylaws,   the candidate, if elected, will comply with the Companys Corporate Governance Guidelines and any other applicable rule, regulation, policy or standard of conduct applicable to the Board and its individual members,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the recommending stockholder and the candidate will promptly provide any additional information requested by the Corporate Governance Committee and/or the Board to assist in the consideration of the candidate, including a completed and signed Questionnaire for Directors and Officers on the Companys standard form and an interview with the Corporate Governance Committee or its representative.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a complete list of the information that must be included in director recommendations submitted by stockholders, please see the Director Recommendations by Stockholders Policy on the Corporate Governance page of the Investors section of our website at www.jbhunt.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committee will consider all director candidates submitted through its established processes and will evaluate each of them, including incumbents, based on the same criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Corporate Governance Committee may prefer incumbent directors and director candidates whom they know personally or who have relevant industry experience and in-depth knowledge of the Companys business and operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policies and procedures as set forth above are intended to provide flexible guidelines for the effective functioning of the Companys director nomination process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board intends to review these policies and procedures periodically and anticipates that modifications may be necessary from time to time as the Companys needs and circumstances change.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committee periodically assesses the appropriate size and composition of the Board and whether any vacancies on the Board are expected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that vacancies are anticipated or otherwise arise, the Corporate Governance Committee will review and assess potential director candidates.

sentences.text: Board Diversity
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As indicated by the criteria above, the Board prefers a mix of background and experience among its members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, the Board is diverse both in gender and ethnic representation, with 30% of our current members reflecting demographic minorities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board does not follow any ratio or formula to determine the appropriate mix.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rather, it uses its judgment to identify nominees whose backgrounds, attributes and experiences, taken as a whole, will contribute to the high standards of Board service to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The effectiveness of this approach is evidenced by the directors participation in insightful and robust yet mutually respectful deliberation that occurs at Board and Committee meetings.

sentences.text: Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company split the titles, roles and responsibilities of the Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer in 1985.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company and the Board believe that, while the duties may be performed by the same person without consequence to either Company operations or stockholders interest, separation of duties allows the Chairman to focus more on active participation by the Board and oversight of management, while the Chief Executive Officer is better able to focus on day-to-day operations of the Company.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose and role of this Code of Ethics is to focus our directors, officers and employees on areas of ethical risk, provide guidance to help them recognize and deal with ethical issues, provide mechanisms to report unethical or unlawful conduct, and help enhance and formalize our culture of integrity, honesty and accountability.

sentences.text: REPORT OF THE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 Executive Compensation Committee (the Compensation Committee) was composed of Coleman H. Peterson, Chairman, Francesca M. Edwardson, Sharilyn S. Gasaway, and Gary C. George, none of whom is an officer or employee of the Company and all of whom have been determined by the Board of Directors of the Company (the Board) to be independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, all members of the Compensation Committee qualify as nonemployee directors for purposes of Rule 16b-3 of the Exchange Act and as outside directors for purposes of Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code, as amended (the Code).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee operates under a written charter adopted by the Board, a copy of which is available on the Corporate Governance page of the Investors section of the Companys website at www.jbhunt.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In carrying out its responsibilities, the Compensation Committee, among other things:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: evaluates and recommends to the independent Board members, for their approval, the annual salaries and bonuses of the Chairman of the Board and the Chief Executive Officer,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: recommends for approval to the independent Board members equity-based compensation awards under the Companys Management Incentive Plan (the MIP), as amended and restated, for the Chairman of the Board and the Chief Executive Officer,   reviews and approves equity-based compensation awards under the Companys MIP, as amended and restated, for the Section 16 reporting officers,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: establishes and certifies the achievement of performance goals under the Companys incentive and performance-based compensation plans,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews and approves the Compensation Committee report to the stockholders and the Compensation Discussion and Analysis (the CD&A) report included in the Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman of the Board recommends to the Compensation Committee the form and amount of compensation to be paid to the Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chief Executive Officer provides recommendations to the Compensation Committee regarding the form and amount of compensation to be paid to executive officers who report directly to him.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the Chairman of the Board, the Chief Executive Officer and the Chief Financial Officer regularly attend Compensation Committee meetings, except for executive sessions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon request, management has provided to the Compensation Committee historical and prospective breakdowns of primary compensation components for each executive officer, as well as tally sheets, wealth accumulation analyses and internal pay equity analyses as described in
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: more detail below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2014 Annual Meeting, the stockholders approved, on an advisory basis, the compensation of the named executive officers (99.5% of votes cast).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes this level of stockholder support reflects a strong endorsement of the Companys compensation policies and decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has considered the results of the last advisory vote on executive compensation in determining the Companys compensation policies and decisions for 2017, and has determined that these policies and decisions are appropriate and in the best interests of the Company and its stockholders at this time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously, at our 2011 Annual Meeting, the stockholders voted for approval of a frequency of holding advisory votes every three years with respect to named executive officer compensation (51% of votes cast).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This nonbinding vote on frequency is required at least once every six years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, advisory votes on both executive compensation and the frequency of holding future advisory votes have been included as Proposal Number Three and Proposal Number Four, respectively, within this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Compensation Committee engaged Meridian Compensation Partners, LLC (Meridian) to review the Companys executive compensation policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meridian was also directed to determine a comparable peer group for executive compensation purposes and to report considerations regarding changes in compensation levels for the NEOs to bring them into the 50th percentile of total direct compensation of the peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meridian is retained by, and reports to, the Compensation Committee to provide compensation analyses and consultation at the Committees request.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee met four times in 2016 to discuss, among other items, the salaries, bonuses and other compensation of the senior executive officers and other key employees of the Company, including the Chairman of the Board and the Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee did not act by unanimous consent at any time in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Historically, the Compensation Committee meets during the first quarter to finalize discussion regarding the Companys performance goals for the previous and current year with respect to performance-based compensation to be paid to executive officers and to approve its report for the Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These goals are approved within 90 days of the beginning of the year, pursuant to the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During other regularly scheduled meetings throughout the year, the Compensation Committee meets to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: discusses any new compensation issues,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: review base compensation, bonus and MIP award analyses,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: approve the engagement of the compensation consultant for annual executive and director compensation surveys,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: review and discuss information provided by the compensation consultant and the recommendations made by the Chairman of the Board and the Chief Executive Officer,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: review the performance of the Company and the individual officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: approve short-term cash bonus and long-term incentive awards, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: determine executives base salaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management also advises the full Board, including the Compensation Committee members, throughout the year of any new issues and developments regarding executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has reviewed and discussed the following CD&A with management, and based upon such review and discussions, the Compensation Committee recommended to the Board that the CD&A be included in the Companys Proxy Statement.

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Introduction
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Discussion and Analysis provides information regarding the compensation paid to our President and Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer and certain other executive officers who were the most highly compensated in calendar year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These individuals, referred to collectively as named executive officers or NEOs, are identified below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: John N. Roberts, III  President and Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: David G. Mee  Executive Vice President, Finance/Administration, Chief Financial Officer and Corporate Secretary   Shelley Simpson  Executive Vice President, Chief Marketing Officer and President of Integrated Capacity Solutions and Truckload
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nicholas Hobbs  Executive Vice President and President of Dedicated Contract Services
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Terrence D. Matthews  Executive Vice President and President of Intermodal The executive position of Chairman of the Board is no longer an NEO of the Company.
