sentences.text: Compensation Philosophy and Principles
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee acknowledges that the transportation industry is highly competitive and that experienced professionals have career mobility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that it competes for executive talent with a large number of companies, some of which have significantly larger market capitalizations and others of which are privately owned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retention of key talent remains critical to our success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys need to focus on retention is compounded by its size and geographic location.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys compensation program is structured to attract, retain and develop executive talent with the ability to assume a broad span of responsibilities and successfully lead complex business units to market-leading positions in the industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that    the ability to attract, retain and provide appropriate incentives for professional personnel, including the senior executive officers and other key employees of the Company, is essential to maintaining the Companys leading competitive position, thereby providing for the long-term success of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees goal is to maintain compensation programs that are competitive within the transportation industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Compensation Committee reviews the executive compensation program with respect to external competitiveness and linkage between executive compensation and creation of stockholder value and determines what changes, if any, are appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation levels should be sufficiently competitive to attract and retain key talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company aims to attract, motivate and retain high-performance talent to achieve and maintain a leading position in its industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our total compensation package should be strongly competitive with other transportation companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation should relate directly to performance and responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total compensation should be tied to and vary with performance and responsibility, both at the Company and individual level, in achieving financial, operational and strategic objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Differentiated pay for high-performing individuals should be proportional to their contributions to the Companys success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Short-term incentive compensation should constitute a significant portion of total executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A large portion of total compensation should be tied to performance, and therefore at risk, as position and responsibility increase.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individuals with greater roles and the ability to directly impact strategic direction and long-term results should bear a greater proportion of the risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term incentive compensation, the Companys Management Incentive Plan (the MIP), should be closely aligned with stockholders interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards of long-term compensation encourages executive officers to focus on the Companys long-range growth and development and incent them to manage from the perspective of stockholders with a meaningful stake in the Company, as well as to focus on long-term career orientation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants in the MIP are required to own Company stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The requirements are discussed in this CD&A under the caption Stock Ownership Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys executive compensation program is designed to reward the achievement of initiatives regarding growth, productivity and people, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: constantly renewing the Companys business model and seeking strategic opportunities that benefit the Company and its stockholders, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: implementing a discipline of compliance and focusing on the highest standards of professional conduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROCESS OF SETTING COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benchmarking Against a Peer Group
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee engaged Meridian to perform a competitive market assessment for the NEOs to evaluate base salary, target annual incentives, target total cash compensation, long-term incentives and total direct compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The assessment involved the use of a peer group, as noted below, consisting of 12 transportation and logistics companies in the national marketplace.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This peer group was updated in 2016 to more closely align the Companys peer group with peers suggested by Institutional Shareholder Services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These companies represent both business competition and the most relevant labor market for our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Avis Budget Group, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CH Robinson Worldwide, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CSX Corporation Expeditors Intl of Washington, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hertz Global Holdings, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hub Group, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Kansas City Southern   Landstar System, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Norfolk Southern Corporation Old Dominion Freight Line, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ryder System, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Swift Transportation Compan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has decided that the appropriate comparative total compensation target should be at the 50th percentile of the respective peer groups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Analysis Tools
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the competitive compensation survey information for each officer that was compiled, the Compensation Committee also reviewed a three-year history of executive compensation tally sheets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee anticipates that pertinent compensation information will continue to be developed and enhanced to allow the Committee to perform the most relevant analyses practicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our objective for total executive compensation is to provide compensation at the 50th percentile of the respective peer groups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that a sizeable portion of overall compensation should be at risk and tied to stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our bonuses are tied to earnings per share (EPS), revenue and earnings before interest and taxes (EBIT); as these items increase, so do executive bonuses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term incentives are used as tools to reward executives for current and future performance, to encourage an executive to remain with the Company and to align the executives interests with those of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of our long-term incentive strategy, executives are expected to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: maintain stock ownership values as a multiple of their base salaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term incentives for NEOs are performance- based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While certain components of compensation are directly tied to the Companys reported financial performance, sufficient accounting and operational controls are in place and tested effectively to ensure that the Companys compensation practices and policies, including those for nonexecutives, are not reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Company has a 401(k) plan that assists participants in providing for retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company contributes to each NEOs account per year based on the NEOs voluntary contribution amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The equity buildup in unvested equity-based awards and stock owned currently is critical to each executives ability to adequately provide for his or her retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As previously mentioned and explained in detail later, we have a Company stock ownership policy for our executives, but we do not have a hold until retirement restriction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not believe that such a restriction is prudent for the employee or necessary to protect our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tally Sheets
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A compensation tally sheet for each NEO was prepared and reviewed by the Compensation Committee in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These tally sheets detail a three-year history of dollar amounts for components of the NEOs total compensation, including current salary and estimated cash bonuses, equity-based awards, change in control severance payments, if any, personal benefits, if any, and other perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long -Term Compensation Analyses and Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to long-term, equity-based awards, the Company maintains the MIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MIP was originally adopted and approved by the Board on March 17, 1989, and an amended and restated MIP was subsequently approved by the stockholders on May 11, 1995.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MIP has been amended and restated since the time of its adoption, and all amendments requiring approval of the stockholders have been approved, with the last approval occurring at our Annual Meeting of Stockholders held in 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, there are 44 million shares of common stock authorized for issuance under the MIP, of which approximately 6.9 million shares are available for future equity-based awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: clarification regarding the effect of the Companys assumption of awards granted under another plan,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a limitation on the number of shares available each year for nonemployee directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a broader provision regarding the Companys discretion to reduce, cancel, seek to forfeit or recoup a participants awards upon the occurrence of certain events,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: clarification that recipients of restricted stock and share unit awards do not have voting or dividend rights until such awar vested,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the addition of methods for payment of the purchase price for any existi   expanded methods for satisfying a participants withholding obligations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a broader provision regarding amendment of the Plan to be based on current applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain provisions of the Restated MIP, as proposed to be approved by stockholders, are described in the following sections of this CD&A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such descriptions are qualified in their entirety by reference to the complete text of the Restated MIP, which is attached as Appendix A to this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based restricted share units, time-vested restricted share units and stock options of the Company are granted under the MIP in an effort to link future compensation to the long-term financial success of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These equity-based awards are granted to executive officers, including the NEOs, and other key employees (approximately 410 individuals) and are intended to attract and retain employees, to provide incentives to enhance job performance, and to enable those persons to participate in the long-term success and growth of the Company through an equity interest in the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee typically grants time-vested restricted share units under the MIP to non-NEO employees of the Company, while granting performance-based restricted share units to the NEOs of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each grant typically vests ratably over five (5) years based on service and performance conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each portion that vests in a particular year, or each tranche, of performance-based awards is contingent on the Companys attainment of predetermined performance metrics established by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Historically, the Compensation Committee has set operating income targets for each tranche of performance based restricted share units granted to NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, while an NEO may receive a grant that vests over a period of years, the operating income performance metric must be met for each tranche in order for the NEO to receive the full value of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Failure to meet the operating income metric for any tranche would cause that portion of the total grant to be forfeited by the NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that restricted share units, both time- vested and performance-based, are currently more effective than stock options in achieving the Companys compensation objectives, as these grants are subject to less market volatility and are less dilutive to stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees realize immediate value as restricted share units vest, with such value increasing as the Companys stock performance increases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash dividends are not paid and there are no voting rights on unvested restricted share units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not have a formal policy, but has an established practice described below, with respect to the granting of any form of equity compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not have a policy or practice of either timing equity-based compensation grants to current or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: new executive officers, or timing the release of material, nonpublic information to affect the value of executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendations for all Section 16 filers, except for the Chairman of the Board and the Chief Executive Officer, are presented to the Compensation Committee by the Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman of the Board recommends to the Compensation Committee the award for the Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee approves or adjusts the award using the above tools for all Section 16 filers, except for the Chairman of the Board and the Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The awards for the Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer are recommended by the Compensation Committee and submitted for final approval to the Companys independent Board members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This process occurs in late October or early November of each year to coincide with our third-quarter Board meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We consider this our annual award date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee does not expect to delegate approval authority to grant awards to management or any subcommittee at this time or in the near future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant date is typically set by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Historically, annual awards of equity compensation have been granted to all awardees, including the NEOs, in October.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, 472,909 grants were made on October 19, and 61,855 grants were made on October 20, the date of the third-quarter Board meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grants have been made in months other than the annual award date on a very limited basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The limited exceptions to this grant-date practice have included, for example, the hiring of a key employee or the promotion of an employee to an executive office.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is currently studying the effects of moving the annual award date to January of each year because the Compensation Committee would have a more complete analysis of the Companys financial performance and the executives individual performance for the full calendar year and would have the most recently available competitive market data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the provisions of the MIP, all stock options are granted with an exercise price equal to 100% of the fair market value of the Companys common stock on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Historically, stock options have been generally exercisable over five to 10 years from the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The exercise price of stock options may be satisfied with payment of cash or previously owned Company stock or, under the terms of the Restated MIP, in the discretion of the Compensation Committee, through a cashless simultaneous exercise and sale through a broker or by a net exercise arrangement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In response to emerging changes in the area of accounting for equity-based compensation and to position ourselves competitively with our peers, the Compensation Committee began granting restricted share units in lieu of stock options under the MIP in 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No stock options are currently outstanding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee anticipates granting restricted share units in lieu of stock options for the foreseeable future, but in the event stock options are granted, such stock options will be granted under the terms discussed above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similar to stock options, the total number of restricted share units that may be awarded to an individual is within the discretion of the Compensation Committee but also limited by the MIP and is generally based on the Companys performance and the individuals current level of compensation, individual performance, potential for promotion and marketability outside the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of restricted share units or stock options previously granted to an individual may be, but is not always, a consideration in determining the amount of awards granted to that individual in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, restricted share units vest over two to 10 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As stated above, the Company does not have a policy or practice of timing the grant of equity-based awards and the release of material, nonpublic information in a manner that would affect compensation for new or current executive officers, nor has it deliberately or knowingly done so.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that material, nonpublic information becomes known to the Compensation Committee, the Company or its employees at a time when such information could affect or otherwise impact the imminent grant of equity-based compensation, management and the Compensation Committee will take the existence of such information under advisement and determine whether to delay the grant of such equity-based compensation to a later date to avoid the appearance of any impropriety.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deductibility of Compensation and Other Regulatory Considerations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code places a limit of $1 million on the amount of compensation the Company may deduct for federal income tax purposes in any one year with respect to the Companys Chief Executive Officer and the next three most highly compensated executive officers whose compensation is required to be disclosed in the Companys annual Proxy Statement, other than the Chief Financial Officer (the Covered Employees).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is an exception to this $1 million limitation for performance-based compensation that meets certain requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In reviewing the effectiveness of the Companys compensation program, the Compensation Committee considers the anticipated tax treatment to the Company and to its executives of various payments and benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the deductibility of certain compensation payments depends upon the timing of an executives vesting or exercise of previously granted awards, as well as interpretations and changes in the tax laws and other factors beyond the Compensation Committees control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For these and other reasons, including the need to maintain flexibility in compensating executive officers in a manner designed to promote varying corporate goals, the Compensation Committee will not necessarily, nor in all circumstances, limit executive compensation to that which is deductible under the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has not adopted a policy requiring all compensation to be deductible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MIP contains specific language and requirements regarding performance-based awards granted to a Covered Employee intended to be qualified performance-based compensation as defined by the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These awards shall be based on the attainment of one or more objective performance goals established in writing by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance goals must be based on one or more criteria approved by the MIP (e.g., revenue, operating income, return on assets) and be based on an objective formula or standard.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is currently using approved targeted quarterly and annual operating income levels as the performance criteria for all outstanding qualified performance- based restricted share awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to any vesting of an award, the Committee must certify in writing that all of the necessary performance goals have been met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Material terms of the performance goals must be disclosed to and reapproved by the stockholders every five years, and, accordingly, these terms have been included in Proposal Two of the Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In October 2016, 142,114 grants of qualified performance- based compensation restricted share units were made to Covered Employees and vest, under the provisions of the MIP, upon the Companys attainment of predetermined performance metrics established and approved by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee will continue to consider various alternatives to preserving the deductibility of compensation payments and benefits to the extent reasonably practicable and to the extent consistent with its other compensation objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salary, bonuses or the vesting of non-performance-based restricted share units do not qualify as performance-based compensation under the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, $878,092 in NEO compensation paid to Nicholas Hobbs was not deductible by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Derivative Trading, Hedging and Trading Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has a policy that prohibits directors, officers or employees from engaging in short sales or in transactions involving derivatives based on the Companys common stock, such as option contracts, straddles, collars, hedges and writing puts or calls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Companys policy requires that directors and executive officers must obtain authorization from the Board before entering into a trading plan that, under the SECs Rule 10b5-1, would permit the sale of the Companys stock including at times when the director or executive officer is in the possession of material nonpublic information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To motivate the Companys officers and senior management to emulate its stockholders, the Company expects its management to own Company stock at levels described in the table shown below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock ownership is defined as stock owned:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: directly or indirectly, and/or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: through the Companys 401(k) Employee Retirement Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Position    Ownership Multiple of Base Salary   Chief Executive Officer      6 times      Executive Vice Presidents      3.5 times      Senior Vice Presidents      2.75 times     Vice Presidents      2.5 times
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has determined that as of the annual award dates, October 19 and October 20, 2016, all of the Companys officers and members of senior management covered by these guidelines had met their ownership goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Retention Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the stock ownership guidelines indicated above, the Company requires all shares obtained by an NEO from the vesting or exercise of restricted share units and stock options to be retained until the established ownership levels have been achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not have any other stock retention policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recovery of Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not have a policy, other than required by law, requiring replacement of awards or payments as a result of an officers illegal transactions or restatements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Compensation Committee has formally adopted and explicitly communicated the clawback provisions of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act with regard to annual cash bonus awards paid to the Companys executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With regard to equity-based awards, the Restated MIP gives the Company broad discretion to reduce, cancel, seek to forfeit or recoup any Plan participants awards upon the breach of any agreement with or obligation to the Company, violation of any Company policy or procedure, or engagement in conduct that is otherwise detrimental to the business or reputation of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since becoming a public company in 1983, the Company has had no illegal actions by its officers or restatements of financial information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company intends to continue its practice of compensating its executives through programs that emphasize performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To that nd, executive compensation is tied directly to the performance of the Company and is structured to ensure that, due to the nature of the usiness and the degree of competitiveness for executive talent, there is an appropriate balance between:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: base salary and incentive compensation,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: short-term and long-term compensation, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: cash and noncash compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each is determined and measured by:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: competitive compensation data
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: financial, operational and strategic goals,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: long-term and short-term performance of the Company compared with its peer group, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: individual contribution to the success of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys primary compensation components are summarized below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, the Companys compensation program consists of an annual base salary, short-term cash incentive awards, and an annual long-term, equity-based award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Primary benefits for executives include participation in the Companys 401(k) plan, health, dental and vision plans, and various insurance plans, including disability and life insurance, all of which are available to all employees on a nondiscriminatory basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company provides limited perquisites to executive officers and other key employees as described in more detail on page 29 under the section titled Other Perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total direct compensation for executive officers, including the NEOs, consists of one or more of the following components:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: base salary,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annual performance-based incentive cash bonus awards,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: long-term incentive/equity-based compensation,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: other benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee, with recommendations from management, works to create what it believes is the best mix of these components in delivering total direct compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining annual compensation, the Compensation Committee reviews all elements of compensation separately and in the aggregate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These compensation components are comparable to those of the Companys competitors and peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In its review of executive compensation, and, in particular, in determining the amount and form of incentive awards discussed below, the Compensation Committee generally considers several factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among these factors are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: amounts paid to the executive officer in prior years as salary,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the officers responsibilities and performance during the calendar year, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At transportation companies, generally the largest elements of compensation are paid in the form of annual short-term incentives and long-term compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation mix and industry profitability vary as the industry faces many risk factors, such as the economy and fuel prices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash compensation for our NEOs varies as the EPS of the Company changes or with the growth of the combination of revenue and EBIT, due to the nature of our bonus plans described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grants of performance-based restricted share units are made annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based restricted share units are based on each employees level of responsibility and are generally computed as a multiple of base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It has been the policy of the Company to put a significant portion of the executives compensation at risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is accomplished by our cash bonus plans, which are directly tied to EPS and revenue and EBIT growth, and the issuance of performance-based restricted share units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity-based awards from the MIP may also vary in vesting from two to 10 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These awards are subject to forfeiture if the employee leaves the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, the future vesting of performance- based equity awards is contingent on the Companys attainment of predetermined performance metrics established by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee and management believe that the proportion of compensation at risk should rise as the employees level of responsibility increases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has retained Meridian as its compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meridian reports directly to the Compensation Committee and has no other engagements with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, Meridian prepared a study providing information and an independent analysis of the Companys executive compensation program and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The results of this study included observations about the Companys target 2016 executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee does not rely solely on predetermined formulas or a limited set of criteria when it evaluates the individual performances of the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers actual results against deliverables and also bases its compensation decisions for the NEOs on:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: leadership,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the execution of business plans,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: strategic results,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: operating results,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: growth in EPS, revenue and EBIT,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: size and complexity of the business,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: experience,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: strengthening of competitive position,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: analysis of competitive compensation practices, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: assessment of the Companys performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Where possible, the above criteria were compared with the peer group selected as well as the Chief Executive Officers input for his direct reports and the Chairman of the Boards input for the Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that competitive levels of cash compensation, together with equity-based and other incentive programs, are necessary for motivating and retaining the Companys executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Salaries provide executives with a base level of monthly income and help achieve the objectives outlined above by attracting and retaining strong talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salaries are evaluated annually for all executive officers, including the Chairman of the Board and the Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, base salaries are not directly related to specific measures of corporate performance, but are determined by the relevance of experience, the scope and complexity of the position, current job responsibilities, retention and relative salaries of the peer group members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may elect not to increase an executive officers annual salary, and has so elected in prior years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if warranted, the Compensation Committee may increase base salary where an executive officer takes on added responsibilities or is promoted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Bonus Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has had in place for several years a bonus plan that is tied to EPS (EPS plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Compensation Committee established a second bonus plan, referred to as the Performance Growth Incentive (PGI) plan, which is tied to year-over-year revenue and EBIT growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When management presents its budget for the following year, the Compensation Committee establishes a matrix of EPS results with corresponding bonus payout levels and a separate PGI matrix of revenue and EBIT growth rates with corresponding bonus payout levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These forecasted revenue and earnings results are based on customer freight trends, strategies for growth and controlling costs, and corporate strategies to maximize stockholder return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once presented to the Board, the financial budget and bonus plan matrices remain fixed, though management continually reforecasts expectations based on actual results and on changing facts and assumptions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changes in uncontrollable factors such as general economic conditions, railroad or port authority service issues, or rapidly fluctuating fuel costs can have a significant impact on the Companys actual financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, as the Company performs against the original budget, the executives bonus performs against the pre- established matrices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has formally adopted and explicitly communicated the clawback provisions of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act with regard to both the EPS and PGI annual cash bonus awards paid to the Companys executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The position of Chairman of the Board is not eligible to participate in the Companys EPS or PGI bonus plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EPS Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the EPS plan was based on annual reported EPS; however, quarterly EPS targets were established.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Company met a quarterly EPS target, the executive was eligible to receive a progress payment equal to approximately 12.5% of his or her projected annual bonus payout.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual bonus payout was reduced by the progress payments received during the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We considered a single quarterly progress payment, computed at approximately 12.5% of the executives lowest possible annual bonus amount, to be the threshold bonus amounts described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2017, the EPS plan has been amended to create a single payout based on the full year 2017 EPS matrix approved by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payout will occur in January 2018 after the full year financial results are publicly reported.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the established matrix consisted of EPS ranging from $3.65 to $4.85, translating to annual bonus payout percentages ranging from 6% to 170% of an executives base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 quarterly and annual bonus payout targets compared with actual reported EPS and actual payout percentages were as follows:

sentences.text: PGI Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The PGI bonus plan is based on targeted annual operating revenue, excluding fuel surcharges (net revenue), and EBIT growth rates and utilizes a single payout in January after full year financial results are publicly reported.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the established PGI matrix consisted of net revenue growth rates ranging from 10% to 12% and EBIT growth rates ranging from 9% to 11%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These ranges translate into annual bonus payout percentages ranging from 75% to 125% of the President and CEOs base salary and 50% to 100% of all other NEOs base salaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The PGI plan is a blended bonus calculation requiring the minimum threshold of both net revenue and EBIT to be met before payout occurs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 annual PGI bonus payout targets compared with actual reported results and actual payout percentages were as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net Revenue / EBIT Growth %     Bonus Payout % of Salary   Period    Minimum     Target    Reported   Minimum   Target   Actual  President and CEO    10.0 / 9.0    10.0 / 9.0    8.9 / 0.7     75.0    75.0        All other NEOs    10.0 / 9.0    10.0 / 9.0    8.9 / 0.7     50.0    50.0
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the required minimum targeted growth rates under the PGI plan were not achieved and no payout was made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long -Term, Equity-Based Award
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each executive is eligible to receive a long-term incentive award of performance-based restricted share units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based restricted share units are intended to help achieve the objectives of the compensation program, including the retention of high-performing and experienced talent, a career orientation and strong alignment with stockholders interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance-based restricted share units are awarded and settled from shares reserved for issuance under the MIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee approves or adjusts the award based on the above criteria for all Section 16 filers who are employees of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The awards for the Companys Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer are presented for final approval to the Companys independent Board members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that performance-based restricted share units must be sufficient in size to provide a strong, long-term performance and retention incentive for executives and to increase their vested interest in the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based restricted share units are used as long-term incentives because they are less dilutive to shares outstanding and to profits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based restricted share units generally vest from two to 10 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In administering the MIP and awarding long-term incentive awards, we are sensitive to the potential for dilution of future EPS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MIP is a broad-based equity compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We focus the program on employees who will have the greatest impact on strategic direction and long-term results of the Company by virtue of their senior roles and responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A total of 682,860 performance-based and time-vested restricted share units were granted in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approximately 21% of the total share units granted were performance-based restricted share units to the NEOs, and approximately 32% of the total share units granted were to the executive officer group as a whole.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described above, MIP participants who hold the title of director and above have an ownership requirement in Company stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining the number of performance-based restricted share unit grants for each NEO, the Compensation Committee reviewed peer market data provided by Meridian and a detailed analysis of each NEOs vested and unvested stock holdings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In considering unvested stock holdings, the Committee reviewed a forecast of the timing of potential future restricted stock unit vesting for each NEO over the next 10 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee subjectively considered the following objectives (without any particular weighting) when determining the form and amount of performance-based restricted share units granted to NEOs in 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reinforce share holdings of NEOs,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shelley Simpson     22,351  Nicholas Hobbs     22,351  Terrence D. Matthews     10,159
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No equity-based compensation was granted to the Chairman of the Board in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 NEO awards shown above are performance-based restricted share units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These grants vest from two to five years annually, beginning July 15, 2017, upon the Companys attainment of predetermined operating metrics established and approved by the Compensation Committee, and are deemed qualified performance-based compensation awards under Section 162(m) of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee acknowledges that the separate components of total direct compensation are not always in the 50th percentile of their respective peer groups, as determined earlier, but it believes that its mix of current and long-term compensation is more appropriate to align the NEOs compensation with the stockholders interests in both the near and longer term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also reviewed its compensation strategy in general and specific components of total direct compensation and determined that none of the Companys compensation programs, individually or as a whole, would create risks that are reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee presented its review and conclusion to the entire Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company administers a Deferred Compensation Plan for certain of its officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The employee participant may elect on an annual basis to defer part of his or her salary and/or annual bonus awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This plan assists key employees in planning for retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company contributes nothing to the plan, and participants are not permitted to defer shares of Company stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Health and Welfare Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company provides benefits such as medical, vision, life insurance, long-term disability coverage, and 401(k) plan opportunities to all eligible employees, including the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company provides up to $750,000 in life insurance coverage and up to $10,000 per month in long-term disability coverage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value of these benefits is not required to be included in the Summary Compensation Table since they are available to all employees on a nondiscriminatory basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company matches certain employee contributions to the 401(k) plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company provides no postretirement medical or supplemental retirement benefits to its employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company also provides vacation, sick leave and other paid holidays to employees, including the NEOs, that are comparable to those provided at other transportation companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys commitment to provide employee benefits is due to our recognition that the health and well-being of our employees contributes directly to a productive and successful work life that produces better results for the Company and for its employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Personal Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company provides certain perquisites to management employees, including the NEOs, as summarized below
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company actively participates in shared ownership of aircraft services with NetJets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With the approval of the Chief Executive Officer, the NEOs and other management employees use Company aircraft services for business purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Personal use of Company aircraft services is provided to executive officers on a very limited basis and to other management employees in the event of emergency or other urgent situations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company Vehicles
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not provide Company-owned cars to executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Perquisites
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company provides executive officers a taxable allowance of up to $10,000 a year for financial counseling services, which may include legal, financial, estate and/or tax planning, and tax return preparation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This benefit is based on actual cost to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company also provides country club memberships to certain of its executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These memberships are valued based on the actual costs of the membership, including dues, regardless of whether use was personal or business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that these clubs provide a quiet venue for negotiations and entertainment of clients, bankers, investment bankers, stockholders, etc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not have employment contracts or predetermined personal severance agreements with any of its executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, according to the terms of the awards granted under the previously mentioned MIP, all outstanding restricted share units are subject to a double triggering event, where both a change in control and an NEOs retirement, termination by the Company without cause or resignation for good reason are required for an accelerated or immediate vesting of the awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, a change in control is deemed to occur when more than 30% of the outstanding shares of common stock of the Company change ownership in a transaction that is a merger, reorganization or consolidation, when the persons who constitute the Companys
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: incumbent board of directors cease to constitute a majority of the board, or upon the consummation of a merger, reorganization, consolidation or similar form of corporate transaction involving the Company that requires the approval of the Companys stockholders where more than 50% of the outstanding shares change ownership or a complete liquidation or dissolution of the Company or the sale or disposition of all or substantially all of the assets of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NUMBER TWO APPROVAL OF THE COMPANYS THIRD AMENDED AND RESTATED MANAGEMENT INCENTIVE PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On January 25, 2017, the Board of Directors adopted and approved, subject to further modification and approval by the Compensation Committee and stockholder approval, the Companys Third Amended and Restated Management Incentive Plan (the Restated MIP).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On February 8, 2017, the Compensation Committee adopted and approved the Restated MIP, subject to stockholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Management Incentive Plan (MIP) was originally adopted and approved by the Board on March 17, 1989, and an amended and restated MIP was subsequently approved by the stockholders on May 11, 1995.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MIP was last amended and restated at our Annual Meeting of Stockholders on April 26, 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Restated MIP will become effective immediately upon stockholder approval of this proposal at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of this amendment and restatement of the MIP is to clarify and update certain provisions of the plan to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the plan and to conform to current best practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The material modifications include a limitation on share recycling, clarification regarding the effect of the Companys assumption of awards granted under another plan, a limitation on the number of shares available each year for non-employee directors, a broader provision regarding the Companys discretion to reduce, cancel, seek to forfeit or recoup a participants awards upon the occurrence of certain events, clarification that recipients of restricted stock and share units awards do not receive voting or dividend rights on such restricted shares or share units unless and until such award is vested, the addition of methods for payment of the purchase price for any existing or future options granted under the Plan, expanded methods for satisfying a participants withholding obligations, the addition of a provision regarding accelerated vesting following a change in control, and a broader provision regarding amendment of the Plan to be based on current applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This amendment and restatement does not increase the number of shares authorized for issuance under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, under Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code, as amended (the Code), the material terms of the performance goals outlined within the Restated MIP must be disclosed to and reapproved by the stockholders every five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The material terms of the performance goals were last approved by the stockholders at our Annual Meeting in 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, this proposal seeks stockholder approval of the Restated MIP, including the material terms of the performance goals under which compensation may be paid that is intended to meet the performance-based compensation exception under Section 162(m) of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each component of the Restated MIP has been approved by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Third Amended and Restated Management Incentive Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following summary of the material provisions of the Restated MIP, as proposed to be approved by stockholders, is qualified in its entirety by reference to the complete text of the Restated MIP, which is attached as Appendix A to this Proxy Statement and incorporated by reference into this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As used in the following summary, the term Plan means the Restated MIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Purpose of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the Plan is to attract, retain and motivate key employees by providing them with the opportunity to participate with the stockholders in the long-term growth and financial success of the Company through the purchase or awarding of shares of common stock or the awarding of share units, money credits or stock appreciation rights, thereby more closely aligning managements interests with those of the Companys stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Administration of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan is administered by our Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee, subject to the limitations in the plan, may construe and interpret the provisions of the Plan; select eligible persons to receive awards; determine the type of grant, whether in the form of stock awards, money credits, share units, stock options, stock appreciation rights or combinations thereof; determine the number of shares subject to the grant; determine the restriction and forfeiture provisions relating to restricted stock; and determine the time and conditions of vesting or exercise, the form of payment, and all other terms of the award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Term of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan will become effective immediately upon stockholder approval and will terminate 10 years after it becomes effective unless terminated earlier by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares Available.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The shares of common stock of the Company issued or to be issued under the Plan may be authorized and unissued shares of common stock, treasury stock or a combination thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum number of shares of common stock that may be issued under the Plan is 44.0 million shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, approximately 6.9 million shares of common stock were available for issuance under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If there is a change in the shares of common stock of the Company because of a recapitalization, reclassification, stock split, stock dividend or consolidation of the common stock, or a merger, consolidation or sale of the Company, the number of shares available for issuance under the Plan and the number of shares that are the subject of any grant will be correspondingly adjusted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys assumption of awards granted under another plan in connection with a merger, consolidation, reorganization or acquisition of property or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: stock, however, will not reduce the maximum number of shares available for issuance under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share Recycling.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, stock subject to an award under the Plan that is canceled, forfeited or expires prior to exercise or realization, either in full or in part, shall again become available for issuance under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, shares subject to an award under the Plan shall not again be made available for issuance or delivery under the Plan if such shares are
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) shares tendered in payment of the exercise price of an option,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) shares delivered or withheld by the Company to satisfy a tax withholding obligation, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) shares covered by a stock-settled stock appreciation right or other awards that were not issued upon the settlement of the award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limitation of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits granted to any plan participant in any one year may not exceed 2% of the total shares of common stock authorized for issuance under the Plan (i.e., 2% of 44 million shares or 880,000 shares).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, benefits granted to any nonemployee director under the plan may not exceed 20,000 shares in any one year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-Based Criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Code limits publicly held companies to an annual deduction for federal income tax purposes of $1.0 million for compensation paid to their Chief Executive Officer and the three next highest compensated executive officers (other than the Chief Financial Officer) determined at the end of each year (referred to as covered employees).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, performance-based compensation that meets certain conditions is excluded from this limitation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any awards that the Compensation Committee intends to qualify for the Section 162(m) performance-based compensation deduction exemption must be based on pre-established, objective performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These goals must be established by the Compensation Committee in writing no later than 90 days after the beginning of the service period to which the award relates and while the outcome is substantially uncertain (i.e., before 25% of the performance period has elapsed).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance goals must be based on an objective formula or standard and may be based on one or more criteria, including net revenue or net revenue growth, gross revenue, basic or diluted earnings per share (before or after taxes), return on assets, return on capital, return on investment, return on sales, productivity, market share, cash flow, generation of free cash, common stock price, operating income, operating expense ratios, quality, delivery performance or level of improvement in any of the foregoing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A performance goal need not, however, be based upon an increase or positive result under a business criterion and could include, for example, maintaining the status quo or limiting economic losses (measured, in each case, by reference to a specific business criterion).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Before the recipient may receive any payment, the Compensation Committee must certify in writing that all of the performance goals have been met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the material terms of the performance goals must be disclosed to and reapproved by the stockholders every five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan allows for the issuance of options that entitle the holder, upon exercise of the option, to purchase from the Company shares of common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such options do not meet the requirements for special tax treatment under the Code (nonqualified options).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The options have an exercise price per share of not less than 100% of the fair market value of the underlying shares on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term of each option is set by the Compensation Committee and may not exceed 10 years from the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also sets the exercise schedule and any other terms, provisions and conditions of the options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options may be exercised upon notice to the Company and payment of the option exercise price and any payroll taxes due.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, if approved by the Compensation Committee, the exercise price for an option may also be satisfied by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) delivery of shares of common stock already owned by the Plan participant, valued at fair market value as of the time of exercise and equal to the purchase price,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a cashless exercise program established with a broker,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) reduction in the number of shares of common stock otherwise deliverable upon exercise of such option with a fair market value equal to the aggregate purchase price at the time of exercise, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) a combination of shares and cash by any of the foregoing methods, equal in the aggregate to the option price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may award a credit of share units, which entitles the holder, upon exercise, to receive from the Company shares of common stock, cash or any combination of the two as determined by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each share unit is equivalent to one share of Company common stock, without dividend or voting privileges.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share units may be granted in the form of performance-based or time-vested awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may also award any of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock awards, which are grants of shares of the Companys common stock subject to certain transfer restrictions set forth by the Compensation Committee and which may be granted in the form of performance-based or fixed awards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: combination of the two as determined by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each money credit is equivalent to one U.S. dollar; and   Stock appreciation rights (SARs), which entitle the holder, upon exercise of such SAR, to receive from the Company shares of common stock, cash or any combination of the two as specified in the exercise request (but subject to approval of the Compensation Committee with respect to any cash payment) having an aggregate value equal to the product of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the excess of the fair market value on the date of exercise over the exercise price per share specified in such SAR or its related option, multiplied by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the number of shares for which such SAR may be exercised.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligibility Under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As noted above, the purpose of the Plan is to provide key employees of the Company the opportunity to receive awards under the Plan, subject to the discretion of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key employees may include employees, officers, directors and consultants of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, the Company believes approximately 410 persons are eligible to participate in the Plan, including 10 executive officers, 392 other employees and eight nonemployee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of consultants eligible to participate in the Plan is not determinable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New Plan Benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No determination has been made with respect to the future recipients of awards under the Plan, and it is not possible to specify the names or positions of persons to whom awards will be granted, or the number of shares, within the limitations of the Plan, to be covered by such awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Forfeiture; Recoupment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may cause a reduction, cancellation, forfeiture or recoupment of any Plan participants rights, payments and benefits with respect to any award granted under the Plan (including realized gains) in the event that such Plan participant breaches any agreement with or obligation to the Company, violates any Company policy or procedure, or engages in conduct that is otherwise detrimental to the business or reputation of the Company, or in the event that such Plan participants service with the Company is terminated for cause.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All awards are subject to mandatory repayment if the participant becomes subject to any clawback or recoupment under Company policy or applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Repricing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Restated MIP prohibits the repricing of stock options and SARs awarded under the Plan, unless such action is approved by the Companys stockholders if required under the rules of any national securities exchange on which the Companys common stock is listed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Withholding Obligations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the Committees discretion, a Plan participant may satisfy any federal, state or local tax withholding obligation relating to any award by any of the following means (or by a combination of such means):
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) remitting a cash payment for the withholding amount,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) authorizing the Company to withhold shares of common stock from the shares otherwise issuable to the Plan participant as a result of the exercise or acquisition of common stock under the award, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) remitting shares already owned by the Plan participant that have an aggregate fair market value equal to the withholding amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Acceleration of Vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All restricted stock and share unit awards are subject to a double triggering event, whereby upon a change in control, a Participants retirement, termination by the Company without cause or resignation for good reason is also required for an accelerated or immediate vesting of the awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, a change in control is deemed to occur when more than 30% of the outstanding shares of common stock of the Company change ownership in a transaction that is a merger, reorganization or consolidation, when the persons who constitute the Companys incumbent board of directors cease to constitute a majority of the board, or upon the consummation of a merger, reorganization, consolidation or similar form of corporate transaction involving the Company that requires the approval of the Companys stockholders where more than 50% of the outstanding shares change ownership or a complete liquidation or dissolution of the Company or the sale or disposition of all or substantially all of the assets of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amendment and Termination of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors may amend or terminate the Plan at any time; however, no amendment may be made without stockholder approval to the extent such stockholder approval is necessary to satisfy applicable laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Federal Income Tax Consequences
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following general summary of the typical federal income tax consequences of the issuance, vesting, exercise and sale of share units, options, stock awards and other awards under the Plan is based on existing provisions of the Code, applicable Treasury regulations, administrative rulings and judicial decisions, all of which are subject to change.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This summary does not describe any foreign, state, local or other tax consequences that may also apply.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Share Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted share units are awarded and settled from shares of common stock reserved for issuance under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A recipient of a restricted share unit has taxable income in an amount equal to the excess of the fair market value of the shares of common stock received on the date the restricted share unit is settled over any consideration paid for the shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The taxable income constitutes wages subject to income and employment tax withholding, and the Company receives a corresponding income tax deduction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The recipient will have a basis in his or her shares of common stock received upon vesting of the units equal to the value of the shares on the date the units vest, at which time the holding period for the shares will begin.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, a sale of the shares will produce capital gain or loss that will be long term or short term depending on the period of time included in the recipients holding period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, an optionee will not be deemed to receive any income for federal income tax purposes upon the grant of any option under the Plan, nor will the Company be entitled to a tax deduction at that time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon the exercise of a nonqualified option, the optionee will be deemed to have received taxable income in an amount equal to the excess of the market price of the shares received on the exercise date over exercise price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company will be allowed a corresponding income tax deduction equal to the excess of market value of the shares on the date of exercise over the cost of such shares to the optionee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Special federal income tax rules apply if the optionee uses shares of common stock to pay all or part of the option exercise price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A recipient of a stock award, such as restricted stock, is generally treated in the same manner as a recipient of a restricted share unit settled in shares of common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN
